title: PHO Public Health Organisation Logo Font
content:
hi schriftenerkenner  
i need some help pretty please...  
does anyone know what fonts the designer  
used for this logo?

sorry i know it’s not the best sample...

jörg

[http://www.inpho.co.nz/\_borders/invercargill%20PHO%20logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208135418/http:/www.inpho.co.nz/_borders/invercargill%20PHO%20logo.jpg "http://www.inpho.co.nz/\_borders/invercargill%20PHO%20logo.jpg")

 [‹ Koller nameplate script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208135418/http:/typophile.com/node/39666 "Go to previous forum topic") [Identifying the Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208135418/http:/typophile.com/node/39762 "Go to next forum topic")
author: agostini

comments.content:
what, a free font?  
well i don’t even want to know how much  
was charged for the font...

thanks so much akira!!!!!!!!!!!
originally designed by Karl Forsberg 1954, [according to Philippe2](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208135418/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=6380)

I don’t like the fact that the caps are thicker compared to the small caps...  
they stand out like dogs balls...
